alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Livingston and southwestern Tangipahoa Parishes through 615 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Springfield, or 9 miles southwest of Hammond, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Walker, Livingston, French Settlement, Albany, Port Vincent, Springfield and Killian. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 14 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston
